info.title: Oxide Management Gateway Service API
info.description: API for interacting with the Oxide control plane's gateway service

get.summary: List SPs via Ignition
get.description: Retreive information for all SPs via the Ignition controller. This is lower latency and has fewer possible failure modes than querying the SP over the management network.

get.summary: Get SP info via Ignition
get.description: Retreive information for an SP via the Ignition controller. This is lower latency and has fewer possible failure modes than querying the SP over the management network.

post.summary: Send an ignition command targeting a specific SP.
post.description:
This endpoint can be used to transition a target between A2 and A3 (via power-on / power-off) or reset it.

The management network traffic caused by requests to this endpoint is between this MGS instance and its local ignition controller, _not_ the SP targeted by the command.

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: Ignition command to perform on the targeted SP.

get.summary: Get the complete list of SP identifiers this MGS instance is configured to
get.description:
find and communicate with.

Note that unlike most MGS endpoints, this endpoint does not send any communication on the management network.

get.summary: Get the identifier for the switch this MGS instance is connected to.
get.description: Note that most MGS endpoints behave identically regardless of which scrimlet the MGS instance is running on; this one, however, is intentionally different. This endpoint is _probably_ only useful for clients communicating with MGS over localhost (i.e., other services in the switch zone) who need to know which sidecar they are connected to.

post.summary: Upload a host phase2 image that can be served to recovering hosts via the
post.description:
host/SP control uart.

MGS caches this image in memory and is limited to a small, fixed number of images (potentially 1). Uploading a new image may evict the least-recently-requested image if our cache is already full.

post.description:
Update a component of an SP according to its specific update mechanism. This interface is generic for all component types, but resolves to a mechanism specific to the given component type. This may fail for a variety of reasons including the update bundle being invalid or improperly specified or due to an error originating from the SP itself.

Note that not all components may be updated; components without known update mechanisms will return an error without any inspection of the update bundle.

Updating the SP itself is done via the component name `sp`.

parameters.name: component
parameters.description: ID for the component of the SP; this is the internal identifier used by the SP itself to identify its components.

parameters.name: firmware_slot
parameters.description: The update slot to apply this image to. Supply 0 if the component only has one update slot.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
An identifier for this update.

This ID applies to this single instance of the API call; it is not an ID of `image` itself. Multiple API calls with the same `image` should use different IDs.

post.summary: Abort any in-progress update an SP component
post.description:
Aborting an update to the SP itself is done via the component name `sp`.

On a successful return, the update corresponding to the given UUID will no longer be in progress (either aborted or applied).

parameters.name: component
parameters.description: ID for the component of the SP; this is the internal identifier used by the SP itself to identify its components.

post.summary: Request ereports from the target service processor.
post.description: Query parameters provide the ENAs of the initial ereport in the returned tranche, the SP's restart ID that the control plane believes is current, and the (optional) last committed ENA.

parameters.name: committed
parameters.description:
The ENA of the last ereport committed to persistent storage from the requested reporter restart generation.

If the restart ID parameter matches the reporter's current restart ID, it is permitted to discard any ereports with ENAs up to and including this value. If the restart ID has changed from the provided one, the reporter will not discard data.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of ereports to return in this tranche.

parameters.name: restart_id
parameters.description:
The restart ID of the reporter at which all other query parameters are valid.

If this value does not match the reporter's restart ID, the reporter's response will include the current generation, and will start at the earliest known ENA, rather than the provided `start_at` ENA.

parameters.name: start_at
parameters.description: If present, the reporter should not include ENAs earlier than this one in its response, provided that the query's requested restart ID matches the current restart ID.

get.summary: Get the most recent host phase2 request we've seen from the target SP.
get.description: This method can be used as an indirect progress report for how far along a host is when it is booting via the MGS -> SP -> UART recovery path. This path is used to install the trampoline image containing installinator to recover a sled.

delete.summary: Clear the most recent host phase2 request we've seen from the target SP.

put.summary: Set the installinator image ID the sled should use for recovery.
put.description: This value can be read by the host via IPCC; see the `ipcc` crate.

delete.summary: Clear any previously-set installinator image ID on the target sled.

PowerState.description:
See RFD 81.

This enum only lists power states the SP is able to control; higher power states are controlled by ignition.

SpComponentFirmwareSlot.description: Identifier for an SP's component's firmware slot; e.g., slots 0 and 1 for the host boot flash.

SpComponentInfo.description: Overview of a single SP component.

capabilities.description: `capabilities` is a bitmask; interpret it via [`gateway_messages::DeviceCapabilities`].

component.description: The unique identifier for this component.

description.description: A human-readable description of the component.

device.description: The name of the physical device.

presence.description: Whether or not the component is present, to the best of the SP's ability to judge.

serial_number.description: The component's serial number, if it has one.

SpComponentList.description: List of components from a single SP.

SpComponentPresence.description:
Description of the presence or absence of a component.

The presence of some components may vary based on the power state of the sled (e.g., components that time out or appear unavailable if the sled is in A2 may become present when the sled moves to A0).

oneOf.description: The component is present but in a failed or faulty state.
The SP is unable to determine the presence of the component.
The SP's attempt to determine the presence of the component timed out.
The SP's attempt to determine the presence of the component failed.

SpSensorReading.description: Result of reading an SP sensor.

timestamp.description:
SP-centric timestamp of when `result` was recorded from this sensor.

Currently this value represents "milliseconds since the last SP boot" and is primarily useful as a delta between sensors on this SP (assuming no reboot in between). The meaning could change with future SP releases.

SpSensorReadingResult.description: Single reading (or error) from an SP sensor.

oneOf.description: The SP has no update status.

The SP is preparing to receive an update.

May or may not include progress, depending on the capabilities of the component being updated.
The SP is currently receiving an update.
The SP has completed receiving an update.
The SP has aborted an in-progress update.
The update process failed with an RoT-specific error.

base64_zip.description: Base64-encoded zip file containing dehydrated task dump.

timestamp.description: Hubris timestamp at which the task crash occurred.

vers.description: `VERS` field from the caboose, if present.

id.description:
The ID of the update to abort.

If the SP is currently receiving an update with this ID, it will be aborted.

If the SP is currently receiving an update with a different ID, the abort request will fail.

If the SP is not currently receiving any update, the request to abort should succeed but will not have actually done anything.

UpdatePreparationProgress.description:
Progress of an SP preparing to update.

The units of `current` and `total` are unspecified and defined by the SP; e.g., if preparing for an update requires erasing a flash device, this may indicate progress of that erasure without defining units (bytes, pages, sectors, etc.).
